place_description: Archive CLT is a Black owned book cafe in Charlotte NC. We offer local roasted coffee and espresso along with your favorite nostalgic books, magazines and relics.

reviews_data.review_text: If you haven't been to Archive...run, don't walk! You are missing out on the best coffee shop vibe in the Queen City! The music, the ephemera and oh yeah...go in the bathroom...thank me later!

Review: 5 Stars
Title: A Soulful Sip of Excellence

From the moment you walk into Archive CLT, you feel it -- the warmth, the pride, the passion. This Black woman-owned gem isn't just a coffee shop; it's a celebration of community, culture, and quality.

The decor is effortlessly cool, blending cozy vibes with an unapologetically bold style that reflects the strength and creativity of its owner. Every detail, from the curated playlist to the artwork on the walls, feels intentional and inviting.

Now let's talk coffee -- rich, smooth, and expertly brewed. Whether you're grabbing a classic latte or trying one of their signature drinks (highly recommend the Dirty chai Latte), each cup is a masterpiece. The pastries and small bites? Equally divine, often locally sourced and always delicious.

What really sets this spot apart, though, is the energy. The owner and her team radiate passion and purpose. You're not just a customer here -- you're part of something. A space that uplifts, nourishes, and reminds you what it means to support local, Black-owned excellence.

This place is more than coffee -- it's culture in a cup. Don't walk, run.

Oh my goodness such a great find. I had the NikkiGingervanni iced Latte and it was perfection. The ambiance of this cafe was so soothing and nostalgic. When I walked in the door I just wanted to sit down and sip on my drink and bask in the space. Great co-working and meeting space.

The Coffee Shop I Never Knew I Needed

Archive is the coffee shop I didn't realize I was missing in my life. I've never really been a coffee shop person, but this place made a newbie like me feel right at home. I've been here a handful of times now--sometimes to read and enjoy a drink, other times to have a meeting and introduce a colleague to this gem of a space.

Right now, I'm fixated on the **Foxy Brown**, and the **blueberry muffin** has me in a chokehold. There are so many great things to say about Archive, but honestly, it's one of those places you just have to experience for yourself. The ambiance sparks both creativity and productivity, making it the perfect spot to work, relax, or connect. Definitely a must-visit!

This is my favorite spot to go to when I need to get out the house and work in a different atmosphere. The owner is so welcoming and warm. You feel serenity as soon as you walk in. It's giving black excellence! Oh and did I mention the coffee is a 10 out of 10!

Literally my favorite location in Charlotte the barista knows my wife and I by name. If you are a member of the urban community in Charlotte or new to Charlotte and wondering how to get connected to the urban locals archive is the place to be. This black woman owned coffee house is also the home of an archival space for black culture, Community building, and strategizing. Come for the coffee stay for the people, explore the bookshelves and purchase in archival item or two.

For outsiders, this coffee shop is located on Beatties Ford a historically black area of Charlotte that has been heavily affected by gentrification if you choose to play patronage to this location, also make sure that you respect the area and the people in which it is located and understand that the choice is probably intentional.

I love Archive. The name definitely represents at the atmosphere you will walk into. We visited for our first time yesterday and I was led to leave a review. We were greeted immediately upon walking in with a warm welcome and assistance with the menu. The coffee was absolutely amazing, so delicious! The art pieces the decorations year books, great job! I look forward to returning

I had a latte with the Foxy Brown flavor, not overly sweet at all, just right. I added a banana nut muffin which taste like banana bread in muffin form.

Beautiful environment. They have archives to Charlotte's history and Black history in general. The names of drinks are perfect.

I had the pleasure of visiting this business on Saturday February 22,2205 around 11am and it was great! The vibe was set to match with the atmosphere. I walked in not sure which line to go to , but it didn't take long to find out. Apparently the other line was for the one's getting muffins or sandwiches. The lady that took my order was so sweet. I didn't see the owner whom I was hoping today hello and job well done! It was my first time there but I don't think it's going to be my last. See you soon Archive CLT
I found a Beautiful gem in the Queen City! I ordered a chai iced coffee and found so much more. Check them out!
Drinks are tasty, and the interior design is the best. The display of all the memorabilia and the wall mural is so cool. And the staff are super friendly

Love this spot! Love it even more that it's on the west side! Matcha was top tier!!! For some reason no one can ever get my drink right on the first try but ARCHIVE did!  Music choice was a vibe! Atmosphere was chill and so much to look at while you waited! Love it here! #supportblackbusinesses
Delicious coffee, cool vibe
What a quaint and eclectic little spot!  Service and coffee was wonderful.  I'll pick here over Starbucks any day.  **Steady minding my B.O.B.!**
I enjoyed the Wild Flower refresher. I just wished it was bigger!!

Great coffee shop! If you're on the west side of CLT go check it out. It's beautiful with such great employees. Everyone was so nice. Will def go back. I tried a half sweet iced vanilla latte and it was great.

I came across this black owned coffee shop while I was in town. Loved it! It's beautiful and the vibes are definitely there. It feel very homey and cozy. It brings me back to the late 80's and 90s. We need one in Atlanta
Wow.  Just wow.  Very good coffee and the atmosphere is what's needed in our country today.  Empowerment!!!
Such an amazing Black owned place with amazing atmosphere! My hot chocolate tasted amazing and there was so much to look at while I waited for my drink

Cheryse has SUCH an amazing vibe and her shop and coffee match!
This spot took me back instantly to cafes in Chicago or NY and had such a good aura.
She's personable, friendly and deserves great reviews from CLT food bloggers, so spread the word and support!
This was my first time there today, but will NOT be my last!
Love everything about this place. The vibe is 10/10

Issa vibe. If you're in the area, stop in. Not in the area, make the journey. It's like hanging out at a friend's place for a study session. That friend has a dope collection of books and albums they'll let you buy and some visually pleasing art on the wall and around the joint that will draw you in when you take a break from working, writing or reading.
My group met here for a book club. I had the Ethiopian drip with oat milk. Delicious! Beautiful area. I love all of the artwork and literature. Definitely a vibe!

Very quaint and cute. Vibe and retro esthetic is welcoming. Perfect for hosting small business meetings. My only constructive feedback is that there are lots of us that would like to continue to support that don't drink coffee or caffeine. It would be nice to have other tea options other than black tea. Other than that, I loved the concept. The person that helped me with my order was very friendly.
This place is great!
Awesome atmosphere, and great service!
Amazing atmosphere and cool cultural collections on display
Staff and vibes are 11/10. Welcoming, warm, and comfortable, it's the spot.
Very polite costumer service and delicious latte

This was truly the best coffee that I have had in a long time. The music is the background not distracting me as I was working. The atmosphere was calming and very welcoming. This place is my new go-to spot for coffee and studying. The people there were extremely nice. I have already recommended my friends to try this spot. Amazing!!! 10/10

Archive Coffee not only serves delicious beverages but the owner is so warm & welcoming and the atmosphere is one of a kind! I'm so impressed by this coffee shop & it's a wonderful area to meet someone new, enjoy a delicious cup of coffee or tea, and to relax or get some work done on your laptop!

Stopped by this place for a quick cup of coffee on the go but that short stop made a lasting impression! The lady who served us was incredibly kind and had such a positive energy. When she found out we were new to the area, she was welcoming and eager to give recommendations for the area. This is a must visit for the art, history and wholesome experience!
I stopped in this shop recently and loved all of the art, music, and overall vibe. We had two lattes and they were PHENOMENAL! Absolutely can't wait to go back!

Charlotte's most serene and uplifting environment! The proprietor and staff are exceptional! Impeccable service and products. Art, records, books, and other nostalgic items are available for purchase. My new favorite place in the QC
Best Coffee shop in Charlotte & the owner is amazing!
Amazing vibe..great people, coffee, matcha and great wifi!!
The cortado was great and the atmosphere is contagious. This is an incredible coffee shop.
Stopped in today and had the best chai tea latte I've ever had! The services was great and the vibe was really chill. Plenty of parking.
Best Coffee spot in West Charlotte! Love the vibe and culture in here.

When you enter archive your immersed into black culture from Books pictures, paintings, music and table games. It's us. There's  table to sit indoors and outdoors to work or enjoy your drink and/or pastry. I enjoyed surfing through the vinyl collection where I went over my budget the experience was worth it. Such as incredible establishment. The staff didnt invite or greet you when entering.   'welcome to Archive. Thanks for stopping in'  that would be nice, making the customers feel welcomed preparing them for an experience giving some personality and character.

Archive is an exceptionally unique coffee shop that is deeply rooted in its location, with the space serving as a direct reflection of the owner and the direction in which the neighborhood is evolving. The atmosphere is always vibrant, filled with art and diverse conversations from a wide range of people. If you're looking to experience a Black-owned, minority female-run coffee shop by a Charlotte, North Carolina native, this is one you should definitely visit.

I've been popping into Coffee Shops to work during my time here and this has been my favorite by far. Love all of the vintage magazines, the book selections and the art work! The owner was super chill and the latte was delicious. Got my work done and I enjoyed the music selection in the background. I definitely will be back either before I leave town or the next time for sure!
Good vibes, nice people, music. Nice black owned business
Cute little coffee shop. Love the atmosphere and the ambiance. Great place to work at or meet with friends. The Foxy Brown Latte is EVERYTHING!!!!

I'm normally hesitant to try new coffee places because it rarely meets my expectations. But as soon as I walked in, I felt the energy. It made me feel like I was at family's house. The drink being amazing is the icing on top! I tried the dirty chai, iced with almond milk & vanilla.

Beautiful space & people. Menu items were pleasing. Must take a selfie in the bathroom. Bag of coffee beans is affordable and staff will grind them for you. Artwork and books for sale. A feel good coffee shop!
Very cool place and I loved my tea refresher!
Awesome place, wish I had discovered Archive CLT sooner
The entire place is decorated with Black culture. It brings back great memories and is a good space for conversations. The atmosphere is very warm and neo-soulish, and the owner is as sweet as pie.

This is the best place to get your coffee. The place has a very cool vibe and is very welcoming to all. The coffee is great! I  recommend the Iced Foxy with Oat Milk!! Archive is a relaxing place to sit and work or hang with friends to catch up.
An atmosphere you won't find anywhere else in CLT.
I was referred by one of my clients to check this place out! It was MORE than what I expected and the drinks were BETTER than Starbucks!!!

I really like this coffee. The grounds are different. I really like them. It's delicious. I'd love to start every morning with this cup of coffee. I got the Mocha visiting from Alaska. I recommend trying her coffee it's unique.
Delicious coffee and a great atmosphere and they have decaf !!!

I found this place on instagram and I decided to go see for myself. The decor is so cute I love the concept of the place. The coffee was good as well they had some cute music playing softly in the background setting the mood. I'd definitely recommend this place for anyone who loves a good cafe.

The absolute best place to get a cup of coffee! The decor and music that they play always gives me a feeling of nostalgia! They also have a great selection of books, vinyls and other items that any collector of memorabilia will adore. The coffee is always fresh and the service is always top tier! You can't go wrong ordering the "Foxy Brown" or "Wildflower" drinks.
One of the few coffee shops in Charlotte that knows how to make a cortado. Great atmosphere and service too. I'll be back!

Top 5 Dirty Chai Lattes in Charlotte...maybe even Top 3! (And I've tried plenty )

It's smaller inside, so not much space to stay and linger for long, but the decor is everything and I enjoyed all the Black history
This was my first visit.  I was hesitant about trying anything since I don't drink teas or coffee. Owner suggested I try "Wildflower" I was a little hesitant but really enjoyed it!!
Black owned!! Really cute vibe. Order the Foxy Brown.
Such a cool space and concept. The staff were so cool and easy-going, and it was such a relaxing environment.
Friendly staff and amazing coffee.
I got a latte with almond milk. It was made perfectly and was delicious. I highly recommend! The atmosphere is relaxing and I love the vintage decor.
The best place to go for black ephemera, coffee, and networking in the heart of the west side of Charlotte!
Quite literally the best vibe in Charlotte.
Such a cute spot!! Foxy Brown is absolutely delicious
Really good coffee

The coffee was very good. I had a drip coffee and sat for a while. There was a musician setting up and I stayed a little while. I am not sure if that happens every Sunday but between the nice lady making coffee and the atmosphere I enjoyed this coffee shop.

This is my favorite coffee, latte and refresher spot in town. The Service is great, the atmosphere and conversations is like non-other. The Dirty Chai Latte is the best drink on the menu in my opinion.

When Archive first opened, I took my co-worker with me after I visited and she cried.  She felt so full with happiness and belonging.  Archive evokes just that and more.  Being at Archive, brings up feelings of nostalgia, happiness, joy, belonging, and pride.  Every inch of Archive is perfectly curated, from the front door to the bathroom.  I love that it's in west Charlotte!  I love sharing this gem with my friends.  An iced dirty chai or the foxy brown (hot or iced) are my go to drinks.  Bonus points:  The owner is super dope, kind, creative, and personable!  She recently had an exhibit at the Mint Museum in Uptown and I thoroughly enjoyed it and appreciated it!
Delightful experience. Stopped here on a whim for our girls day out and absolutely loved the atmosphere, the service, and the coffee. 10/10
What is there not to love?!?
The vibe is doubly comforting--nostalgic magazine covers and cozy atmosphere with tasty coffee and tea selections. I had the chai tea latte and it was perfection.

I'm not a coffee drinker but I love love love the refreshers that they offer so tasty! Aside from that the space is absolutely beautiful, comforting, and welcoming. One of my favorite places to visit in Charlotte

Visiting Archive CLT wasn't just a trip to get a VERY GOOD, EXPERTLY PULLED, AND PERFECTLY PORPOTIONED HOT CARAMEL LATTE; it was a beautiful demonstration of the natural bonds in our community, and the many ways we love, embrace, and make family of everyone who wishes to give and receive great energy and create authentic connections.

I'm a recent transplant, and this place immediately became my new living room.

Upon walking in you'll be surround by vintage memorabilia celebrating black roots and culture, and most likely be greeted by a friendly and vibrant group of people who want to know your name, how you're doing, and where you've been!

You could be invited to sit and chat about new city happenings, or historic people, places, and events that will endear you to the Queen's City in ways you hadn't yet considered.

I was enriched by my time with regulars Jackie, Ken, and Chris today, and just can't possibly scream how beautiful a soul the owner is!

Please be intentional about making the trip and inquring about all the community development work planned in partnership with Archive. I promise, you won't regret it!!!

See you there soon!!!!!!

*I was not paid to post this review.
Friendly customer service and amazing atmosphere. My Blackness has found a home outside of home and we need more places like this!
I deliver here , with the best coffee and Products being delivered i highly recommend getting a cup. The owners are great people
Super delicioso, cafe super bien hecho. Muy acogedor.
They had great coffee here, the atmosphere is on point. This place offer a since peace but also they have pretty good music playing. To me if feels like a 90s especially with all the magazines.
Great atmosphere! Met the owner, she is amazing!
A small and cute coffee shop with great service and quality. I had the iced latte and it's pretty good. They use environmentally friendly  plastic.
Great people, space, and coffee. Always a great visit at Archive!!!
Dope spot soaked in culture! Highly recommend!

My son invited me here and I really love it.
Very unique very classic over the top
My Ice coffee was Great
Can't wait to come back I love all the magazines and the pictures are awesome
A gem of a coffee shop! The refresher was amazing and coffee is great too! The shop has a lot of great artwork and artifacts featuring black culture. 10/10 recommend!
Really cool cafe. Love the decor and customer service was excellent. I got an iced chai with vanilla. Excellent.
This place was awesome with great Black memorabilia. We loved it so much!!

What a unique space! Thank you to the owner for creating it. I think people overuse the term "a vibe"... and it takes away from a space like this that is exactly A WHOLE VIBE. Lovely staff, amazing art and vintage items to purchase, even the other clientele were awesome to chat with. We got the Foxy Brown Latte and Feeling Good hot tea and loved them both. I would definitely visit again. Enderly coffee roasts their coffee beans and supporting local businesses, who are also supporting local businesses makes our heart grow three sizes bigger (scientific fact ... look it up).

This is the perfect example of coffee shop. It has culture, good people, and good coffee. It's even better that it's black-owned and operated.

The staff have been fantastic, chill, and welcoming. Been here twice, and have brought friends back and will continue to do so. Definitely worth stopping to see it.
Beautiful space with delicious food and drinks. Had the wildflower iced drink. So good!
The coolest coffee shop in Charlotte!
Fun gem in the community. Delicious coffee, beautiful and interesting artwork and viewing materials. Pleasant staff.
The music, the books, the menu...it's all a tiny vibe! And the Vegan Chai Poundcake is worth a trip back all by itself!
My favorite local coffee shop.

The chai iced latter was the best I've ever had. The DJ played great music on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Perfect day to be in the cafe. My only critique is more comfortable chairs. They were all hard no cushions for back or bottom.
Great vibes in this place. I felt very welcomed. Come here for exclusive retro black art and books. Dope spot!

I love this place and the fact that it's a black owned business. Not only can you get coffee, tea, sandwiches, and pastries but the ambiance is absolutely amazing. They also have a wide variety of books to choose from that you can purchase. This is definitely one of my favorite spots in the city.

Received disappointing customer service after we had informed the barista it was our first time visiting and how we were excited to try their one of their signature tea drinks of which we paid happily and proceeded to wait while enjoying the atmosphere while smelling the enriched coffee bean aroma. However, after we noted it had been 15 minutes we checked in on the order and noted the barista was very busy and assumed our order would surely be ready momentarily, however that was not the case in fact our order after 30 minutes of waiting was noted to have been totally omitted by the barista at which we was totally surprised at this revelation and immediately requested a refund. The seemingly manager or team lead tried to correct the problem, however we were shocked at the disrespect and proceeded with the refund request. In the end we were looking forward to establishing a long lasting customer relationship as well as offering recommendations to family and friends. The customer service received was unexpected and highly disappointing and add insult to injury the barista chimed in after the refund was being processed and say " it was for 2, right"?...unbelievable! So if the barista remembered that info of the order, why did they not fulfill the order? Just unbelievable and never again! In the end we were redeemed at Starbucks
An absolute gem, the atmosphere is great and the staff are incredible, and I really dug the art on the wall. I'll definitely stop in if I'm working in the area again!

You can feel the vibe the moment you open the door. Archive is a vibrant and artsy coffee shop, that overflows with culture. Black culture! From vintage magazines and photos, to Black authors, to an playlist. You get all of this before you even order your beverage. I ordered their house drip coffee which was very tasty. The coffee has more of a fruity taste and was very smooth. They also sell used book and have an impressive selection. If you are in the Beatties Ford area, I would definitely give it a try.
Very friendly/relaxing environment. Check this shop out!

Amazing local coffee shop and archive/vintage store dedicated to Black history and culture.

The owner Cheryse is simultaneously one of the kindest and most powerful entrepreneurs I've met. The coffee shop offers lattes and pastries, but more importantly, a space to uplift the artists, authors, advocates, and historians across decades of Black history.

Incredible collection of magazines, books, posters, music and more. A must visit in Charlotte!
Great vibe, excellent coffee, and wonderful people!
My new favorite coffee shop!

The best coffee shop I've been too. This shop is owned by a young black woman who saw a need and fixed it. The coffee is great but the atmosphere is even better. There is black memorabilia posted everywhere and for sell. There is a hand drawn moral of greats both old and new too. Don't be surprised if you see a table of people working in one corner and another table with people playing games. It's a very welcoming and relaxing place.
Great atmosphere, great caramel latte.
Great coffee, Great people

This black woman owned business is the bomb dot com.

I wish I had the raw videos of the store but I've misplaced them. This book store doubles as a cafe!

Come work, sip, read or relax -- it's a vibe!

Oddly I really love what they did with the bathroom
The best coffee I have ever had! Check them out!
This is something we've needed and  what I've wanted to see in Charlotte for a long time!  It's not near my home,  but I'll drive to support.
Black owned, nice and chill atmosphere
Love it there. Absolutely amazing!!
I have tried the cold brew at just about every coffee shop in Charlotte, but after trying Archive's today I have found a new favorite! The zucchini muffin and Foxy Brown Latte are also very good.
Beautiful, warm space. Lovely owner. Delicious chai tea latte!
So excited to have a coffee shop in this area!

I finally got over to Archive coffee today, and it lives up to the hype! Such a cool spot, and you won't receive this warm of a welcome anywhere else. The place definitely makes you want to come in and enjoy yourself. The kind vibe comes through in the coffee too, because for the first time I didn't even use sugar in my Americano. It tasted that good! I hope to return soon.
So friendly!! The latte was perfect and the warmed zucchini bread was delicious

This quickly became one of my favorite places in ALL of Charlotte. You walk in and the vibe makes you feel right at home. It's a beautiful celebration of the black experience, and oh yea, the coffee is amazing!

The mind of a black woman is capable of anything. The Archive is a great example of a black woman's creativity mixed with business sense. This place is a time capsule of black culture that's needs to be displayed and explored. From the black art to menu, every detail was hand picked. Words cannot describe how amazing this cafe is to me. Please come visit and support a black business.

Solid coffee and really good environment.  They sell records and art too.  The cold brew needed creamer.  I  would try something else next time.  My fiance got the foxy brown which was very good.  Parking was easy when we went on a Sunday.
Beautiful space in this neighborhood. Love coming here for tea.
Archive is one of the coolest spots in Charlotte. They have great coffee, immaculate vibes and plenty of historical hip hop magazines. There really is no place like Archive.
This space is sacred. It's of the culture. For the culture. A true gem. Oh. And they NEVER spell my name wrong on my coffee cup! Bloop! Get into it! Archive is here to stay.
Best customer experience ever
The decor, vibe, and service are amazing. Such a beautifully curated space! Coffee was also amazing!
Black owned. Great experience. Beautiful environment.
I wish I was able to get the young lady's name that was working when my family and I visited this past Saturday, but she offered wonderful customer service and my coffee was great.
Great find.  Cool decor, modern, friendly staff, and delicious coffee.

Black & women owned, love the ambience and the homage to the classics with the vintage prints you can buy, wall of black excellence & the oldies they constantly play. They have vegan bakery items, and great coffee! Its a great space for all ages and the only space Ive seen created for Black communities around CLT to work,  chill & network.

The coffee was delicious! We ordered a Dirty Chai and a Vanilla Latte. The coffee was well balanced and perfectly spiced. The space is extremely cute and artistic. I loved the vibe and it was filled with other Charlotte people enjoying work and conversations.

Hands-down one of my favorite spots in the city! The music, atmosphere, aesthetics, vibes and staff are all amazing! The owner is super personable, I love that you can also buy books from Black authors inside and all of the beverage options are great; You must try the Wildflower or Foxy Brown drink if you visit!
Awesome vibes, even better coffee, great cappuccino and the foxy brown latte was awesome!
Great coffee,  great vibe, great people.
Beautiful establishment!! And great service.

Black woman owned coffee shop with black vintage books & magazines, such as Vibe & Jet. Speaking of vibe, Archive is one!!! I love that they personalize your order. The hot Foxy Brown Latte is amazing. You'll definitely want to have a seat & stay awhile.
Amazing coffee shop!
This place is very dope. Great people and great vibe.
The coffee tastes amazing and the music is on point. This will definitely be my new spot for coffee.
Archive is so much more than books and coffee. It is a cultural hub. It's the type of place where every one feels like there's something just for them.

Super excited to have Archive in our neighborhood! The owner Cheryse Terry recommend I try their "Dirty" Latte and I was immediately hooked! Great tasting coffee, amazing service and beautiful vintage decor!

Excellent customer service!!! I start off with that because most places can't find those two words in a dictionary. Archive, is a whole vibe. It's modern and comfortable flashback Black nostalgia, served up with a yummy muffin and latte.

I would recomment you go experience this vibe for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

This spot is the new brunch spot in the heart of Charlotte!!! I love the service! Very professional, very quick and tastes very very good! The owner is super cool and very intelligent. I highly recommend everyone to stop by, grab a coffee or tea and get inspired by the black excellence!! Please try the Banana Nut Muffin!!
Affordable, excellent customer service, & lovely aesthetics! I will be back!

I stop in for a lunch snack and a drink and enjoy some tunes.The staff was amazing, I also browse the book shelf, purchasing an comic book "The A Team" I definitely will be back.Cheryse has created a space for everyone to enjoy themselves.
Great coffee and awesome collection of vintage Jet and Ebony magazines!  Let's support this gem!

My wife and I stopped in for the grand opening today and got a few drinks to support the business...service was great and drinks came up quickly...look forward to coming back and enjoying a refreshing drink....thanks
